skill.name: nx-workspace-patterns
skill.description: Configure and optimize Nx monorepo workspaces. Use when setting up Nx, configuring project boundaries, optimizing build caching, or implementing affected commands.
skill.summary: Configure and optimize Nx monorepo workspaces. Use when setting up Nx, configuring project boundarie...

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, network exfiltration, or execution risks detected. Content is static guidance and templates for Nx configuration.

content.value_statement: Nx workspaces can become inconsistent and slow without clear patterns. This skill provides proven templates to standardize structure, boundaries, caching, and affected workflows.
actual_capabilities: Provide nx.json configuration template for caching and defaults
Provide project.json template for application targets
Provide ESLint module boundary rules template
Provide custom generator example for feature libraries
Provide CI workflow example using affected commands
Provide remote caching setup examples for Nx Cloud and S3
limitations: Does not run Nx commands or change files automatically
Does not validate existing workspace configuration
Examples are generic and require adaptation to your repo
Does not provision cloud credentials or secrets

use_cases.title: Standardize a new workspace
use_cases.description: Create a consistent Nx workspace layout with caching and module boundaries.

use_cases.title: Speed up CI builds
use_cases.description: Adopt affected commands and caching to reduce build and test time.

use_cases.title: Enforce library boundaries
use_cases.description: Define tags and module rules to keep UI and data layers separated.

prompt_templates.title: Starter setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a basic nx.json template with cacheable operations and target defaults for a new Nx workspace.

prompt_templates.title: Project config
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a project.json for an Nx web app using webpack with build, serve, test, and lint targets.

prompt_templates.title: Boundary rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Create ESLint module boundary rules for app, feature, ui, data-access, and util libraries.

prompt_templates.title: CI affected flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest a GitHub Actions workflow that runs affected lint, test, build, and e2e tasks in Nx.

output_examples.input: I need Nx module boundary rules for app and feature libraries.
output: Define tags for app, feature, ui, data-access, and util libraries
Set app to depend on feature, ui, data-access, and util
Set feature to depend only on ui, data-access, and util

best_practices: Use consistent tags and enforce them with module boundaries
Enable caching and affected commands early in CI
Keep libraries focused and document their purpose
anti_patterns: Skipping module boundaries and allowing cross-layer imports
Running full test suites when affected would suffice
Creating too many tiny libraries without clear scope

faq.question: Is this compatible with Nx 16 and newer?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns target modern Nx versions and standard project.json setups.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides templates and guidance only, not automated changes or validations.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing CI?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes affected command patterns that can be added to most CI systems.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it does not read files, environment variables, or network resources.

faq.question: What if my Nx commands fail?
faq.answer: Check your Nx version, project.json paths, and cache settings for mismatches.

faq.question: How does it compare to Nx docs?
faq.answer: It condenses common patterns into ready templates for faster setup.
